article.headline: Old Dominion 77, VMI 62
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. (AP) -- Arnaud Dahi and Isaiah Hunter each had 20 points as Old Dominion beat VMI 77-62 Wednesday night. Dahi scored 15 of his 20 points during the second half for the Monarchs (4-1), who came back from a 31-30 halftime deficit for the win. Alex Loughton added 17. The game was tied five times in the first half before Hunter sank two free-throws to go up 30-28 with 57 seconds left before the break. Reggie Williams made one of two free throws and Matt Murrer scored with 36 second left to put the Keydets (0-4) ahead at halftime. VMI pulled ahead by seven off a three-point play by Hunter. It was tied twice more before Dahi's layup with 11:47 to go put the Monarchs up for good. They went on to lead by as many as 17. Old Dominion controlled the boards 44-37, led by Loughton's 10 rebounds. Williams led the Keydets with 18, and Murrer and Chavis Holmes each had 12 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
